item.title: Global Object Managing System [NoobFriendly]
item.dc:creator: @relexlawl relexlawl
item.description:
@relexlawl wrote:

Should work on naming a bit more, i.e objectX, it’s in the Object class so I already know it’s the x coordinate, might as well name it x and to make it a bit easier to use, make a getter and setter for it, same goes for the rest, objectIndex -> index.

This is basically the same thing PI has, but with index (unique id for each object), which I guess is okay, thanks for the contribution.

this was from the server

this is the problem area at class 70 if you think there no big deal and can be deleted ill do that. for now i havent really used any object 3 stuff so im unsure on how this will affect it. i have tried adding in [Object.Object o : server.objects){] but no luck still fail

/*object file for (Object o : server.objects) { if ((o.type == 3) && (objectX == o.x) && (objectY == o.y) && (objectID == o.id)) { oooFound = true; break; } } if (!oooFound && adding) server.objects.add(new Object(objectID, objectX, objectY, 3)); if (oooFound && (objectID == 1739)) { heightLevel -= 1; toX = absX; toY = absY; }*/

and you probably know this already but if not this was the old object file before adding in your Object.java

[code]public class Object {
public int id, x, y, type;

public Object(int id, int x, int y, int type) {
	this.id = id;
	this.x = x;
	this.y = y;
	this.type = type;
}

}[/code]

item.title: Global Object Managing System [NoobFriendly]
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Information:
I created a new object managing system, which I wasn’t going to share.
But instead of complaining about how bad rsps still are, we should aim on releasing new content. (talking to more advanced programmers now)

This is created on my own base which is based of delta.
I tried to make this tutorial with the eye on regular delta’s but it should be very easy to convert to any base.
For any questions/errors about this tutorial you can leave a reply and I will answer asap.
All explanation is added between the code itself, don’t hesitate to PM me for more explanation (that doesn’t mean for spoonfedding or things unrelated to this tutorial)

Content:

[ul][li]Loading objects via a file. (To delete existing objects or add new objects, you just add em to a cfg file)[/li]
[li]Adding a temporary object only for one player visible.[/li]
[li]Adding a temporary object visible for all players on the server. (e.g. you want a stump to be visible for everyone not for only the players in the region like how current servers do it.[/li]
[li]Returning ^ the original object with a timer, or removing it again (fires) for all players on the server.[/li][/ul]

Media:
Excuse me for the video being fucked up, don’t feel like doing a new one, you still can see what I wanted to show.
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cV5JxaMJ164&feature=youtu.be[/youtube]

Adding the system yourself:

Step 1:

  • Remove everything that has to do with objects
    e.g. deletethatobject & makeglobalobject methods, createnewtileobject method ect…
    also object.java which some servers will have, you can remove the whole file

Step 2:

  • Add a new java file and name it Object.java
  • Add this code to it:

[code=java]
/**

  • @Author: RandQm
    */
    public class Object {

    /*

    • Our required variables
      */
      public int objectIndex;
      public int objectType;
      public int originalObject;
      public int objectX;
      public int objectY;
      public int objectStandTime;
      public int objectCreator;

    public boolean tempObject;

    /*

    • Creating a new object in the server & setting the data for it.
      */
      public Object (int objIndex, int objType, int original, int objX, int objY, int objST, int objC, boolean temp) {
      objectIndex = objIndex;
      objectType = objType;
      originalObject = original;
      objectX = objX;
      objectY = objY;
      objectStandTime = objST;
      objectCreator = objC;
      tempObject = temp;
      createObject();
      }

    /*

    • Creating a new object on the map visible for all players in the region.
      /
      public void createObject() {
      /
      • Loops through all players online.
        /
        for (Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {
        if (p != null) {
        client person = (client) p;
        if (person.playerName != null || person.playerName != “null”) {
        /
        * Spawn a new object
        */
        server.objectManager.addObject(person, objectX, objectY, objectType, 0, 10);
        }
        }
        }
        }

    /*

    • Deleting a temporary object from the map.
      /
      public void deleteTempObject (final int objX, final int objY, final int objCreator) {
      /
      • Loops through all players online
        /
        for (Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {
        if (p != null) {
        client person = (client) p;
        if (person.playerName != null || person.playerName != “null”) {
        /
        * If the object has been replaced by an already existing one,
        * the original object get respawned after the timer runs out.
        /
        if (!tempObject) {
        server.objectManager.addObject(person, objectX, objectY, originalObject, 0, 10);
        /
        * if the object is temporary it will be deleted from the map after the timer runs out
        */
        } else {
        server.objectManager.replaceObject(person, objectX, objectY, -1, 0, 10);
        }
        }
        }
        }
        }

}[/code]

Step 3:

  • Create another java file and call it ObjectManager.java
  • Add this code into it:
/**
 * @Author: RandQm
 */

import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.FileReader;
import java.io.IOException;

public class ObjectManager {
	
	private static final int MAX_OBJECTS = 1000;
	
	private Object objects[] = new Object[MAX_OBJECTS];
	
	
	/*
	 * Replacing an existing object by a new object.
	 */
	public void replaceObject (client c, int x, int y, int objId, int face, int type) {
		c.outStream.createFrame(85);
		c.outStream.writeByteC(y - (c.mapRegionY * 8));
		c.outStream.writeByteC(x - (c.mapRegionX * 8));
		c.outStream.createFrame(101);
		c.outStream.writeByteC((type << 2) + (face & 3));
		c.outStream.writeByte(0);
		if (objId != -1) {
			c.outStream.createFrame(151);
			c.outStream.writeByteS(0);
			c.outStream.writeWordBigEndian(objId);
			c.outStream.writeByteS((type << 2) + (face & 3));
		}
	}
	
	/*
	 * Create a new private object on the map.
	 */
	public void addObject (client c, int x, int y, int objId, int face, int type) {
		c.outStream.createFrame(85);
		c.outStream.writeByteC(y - (c.mapRegionY * 8));
		c.outStream.writeByteC(x - (c.mapRegionX * 8));
		c.outStream.createFrame(151);
		c.outStream.writeByteA(0);
		c.outStream.writeWordBigEndian(objId);
		c.outStream.writeByteS((type << 2) + (face & 3));
	}
	
	
	/*
	 * Removing all temporary objects.
	 */
	public ObjectManager() {
		for (int i = 0; i < MAX_OBJECTS; i++) {
			objects[i] = null;
		}
	}
	
	/*
	 * Create a new object on the map visible for all players in the region.
	 */
	public void addGlobalObject (int objType, int original, int objX, int objY, int objStandTime, int objCreator, boolean temp) {
		/*
		 * Picks a new value from (maxobjects) everytime a new object gets added, until there are no unused values anymore,
		 * this is to make the server recognize every object as unique, so if we spawn multiple of the same object,
		 * it still recognizes em as different ones
		 */
		int slot = -1;
		for (int i = 1; i < MAX_OBJECTS; i++) {
			if (objects[i] == null) {
				slot = i;
				break;
			}
		}
		if (slot == -1)
			return;
		/*
		 * Creating the new object via Object.java you just added
		 */
		Object newObjects = new Object(slot, objType, original, objX, objY, objStandTime, objCreator, temp);
		objects[slot] = newObjects;
	}
	
	/*
	 * Updating a temporary object.
	 */
	private void updateObjects (final int objIndex, final int objX, final int objY, final int objId) {
		/*
		 * Loops through all players
		 */
		for (Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {
			if (p != null) {
				client person = (client) p;
				if (person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null") {
					/*
					 * If a player online has changed region, or logged in,
					 * objects will be updated for that person.
					 */
					if (person.changedRegion) {
						objects[objIndex].createObject();
						person.changedRegion = false;
					}
				}
			}
		}
	}
	
	/*
	 * Object processing
	 */
	public void process() {
		for (int i = 0; i < MAX_OBJECTS; i++) {
			if (objects[i] != null) { //If there are objects created then...
				if (objects[i].objectStandTime > 0) { //the standtimer of the object will run
					objects[i].objectStandTime --;
					//checks if objects have to be updated for a player
					updateObjects(i, objects[i].objectX, objects[i].objectY, objects[i].objectType);
				} else { //if the timer ran out it will delete or replace(by the original) the object
					objects[i].deleteTempObject(objects[i].objectX, objects[i].objectY, objects[i].objectCreator);
					objects[i] = null; //makes the used slot by the object available again
				}
			}
		}
	}
	
	/*
	 * Adding static, not originally existing objects to the players map.
	 * Deleting originally existing objects from the player map.
	 * This method is to read our cfg file we are adding for ^ dat
	 */
	public boolean loadWorldObjects (client c, String FileName) {
		String line = "";
		String token = "";
		String token2 = "";
		String token2_2 = "";
		String[] token3 = new String[10];
		boolean EndOfFile = false;
		BufferedReader characterfile = null;
		try {
			characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("config\\" + FileName));
		} catch (FileNotFoundException fileex) {
			System.out.println(FileName + ": file not found.");
			return false;
		}
		try {
			line = characterfile.readLine();
		} catch (IOException ioexception) {
			System.out.println(FileName + ": error loading file.");
			return false;
		}
		while ((EndOfFile == false) && (line != null)) {
			line = line.trim();
			int spot = line.indexOf("=");
			if (spot > -1) {
				token = line.substring(0, spot);
				token = token.trim();
				token2 = line.substring(spot + 1);
				token2 = token2.trim();
				token2_2 = token2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token3 = token2_2.split("\t");
				if (token.equals("add")) {
					addObject(c, Integer.parseInt(token3[0]), Integer.parseInt(token3[1]), Integer.parseInt(token3[2]), 0, 10);
				}
				if (token.equals("delete")) {
					replaceObject(c, Integer.parseInt(token3[0]), Integer.parseInt(token3[1]), -1, 0, 10);
				}
			} else {
				if (line.equals("[ENDOFOBJECTLIST]")) {
					try {
						characterfile.close();
					} catch (IOException ioexception) {
					}
					return true;
				}
			}
			try {
				line = characterfile.readLine();
			} catch (IOException ioexception1) {
				EndOfFile = true;
			}
		}
		try {
			characterfile.close();
		} catch (IOException ioexception) {
		}
		return false;
	}

}

Step 4:

  • Go into the directory where your cfg files are located, this will most probably be the folder called “config”
    if it isn’t, don’t forget to change the path in the code to load the file from the previous step.
  • Add a new file and call it worldObjects.cfg
  • then add this code into it:
/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
//To create a new object on the map:                       //
//add = objectCoordinateX	objectCoordinateY	objectId  //
/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
add = 0000	0000	0

/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
//To delete an existing object on the map:                 //
//delete = objectCoordinateX	objectCoordinateY         //
/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
delete = 0000	0000

[ENDOFOBJECTLIST]

Step 5:

  • Open your server.java
  • add in there (you’ll see more lines similar to this)
public static ObjectManager objectManager = null;
  • And a bit lower inside ‘public static void main’, with the others similar to this:
objectManager = new ObjectManager();

Step 6:

  • Now open process.java and with the similar lines (e.g. “server.playerHandler.process();”)
    add this line: this is to keep our object process running
server.objectManager.process();

Step 7:

  • Now open your client.java and search for:
void initialize()[/code]
This is where your welcome message ect is located, if you scroll down till the end of the method you should see one or more of these:
[code=java]
setInterfaceWalkable(6673);
			playerLastConnect = connectedFrom;
[/code]

above that add this line:
[code=java]
server.objectManager.loadWorldObjects(this, "worldObjects.cfg");
[/code]
this is to load the objects from our cfg file when the player logs in.


[b]Step 8:[/b]
 - We will add a check, to declare that a player has changed a region so we can update the objects, so we will need the region packet.
 - First open Player.java and add this variable with the others:
[code=java]
public boolean changedRegion;
[/code]

 - Now in Client.java search for [code=java]
case 210:

And add this under it:

changedRegion = true;

NOTE:

  • You will have some errors (at least if you removed everything right) since different sources have different content.
    This is an example of what you would have to change:

ORIGINAL:

				ReplaceObject(DoorHandler.doorX[d],
						DoorHandler.doorY[d],
						DoorHandler.doorId[d],
						DoorHandler.doorFace[d], 0);

SHOULD BECOME

				ServerConstants.objectManager.replaceObject(this, DoorHandler.doorX[d],
						DoorHandler.doorY[d],
						DoorHandler.doorId[d],
						DoorHandler.doorFace[d], 0);

[i]Only leave errors when you are sure you finished with adding the tutorial correctly.
Using this system for other purposes like skills ect, you just create a new global object.
This ^you will have to figure out yourself, I’m not helping with that.

If no one appreciates it, I’ll remove it.[/i]

Read full topic
